channel.title: Model Grabber Question
channel.description:
ok, i understand the model grabber, and i am going to run it over night so i can get all 26,000+ models loaded, my question is that after all models load will it automaticly work on my server, or do i have to do another step? Please Help!
I Sis I

item.title: Model Grabber Question
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Wolfeyes217:

To add the new models in you have to unpack the cache and just add them into the model folder then repack it.

Or - and I’m surprised no one seems to have thought of this - you could edit the client to read raw models instead of trying to unpack them. I haven’t looked at it in a while so I’m not sure where you’d start, but I can’t think of any reason it absolutely wouldn’t work. Seems like it would be more a matter of removing code than adding anything new.

Read full topic

item.title: Model Grabber Question
item.dc:creator: @Wolfeyes217 Wolfeyes217
item.description:
@Wolfeyes217 wrote:

To add the new models in you have to unpack the cache and just add them into the model folder then repack it.

Read full topic

item.title: Model Grabber Question
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:11, topic:135056”][quote author=botmaster link=topic=186491.msg1712163#msg1712163 date=1188400465]
Quick question: What file format are these models in? I want to go and make an import script in python for blender3d, so I can edit them. This may require some research into the model format, so to spare some time, I’d rather ask here. If you don’t know, it’s okay, then I’ll have to do it from scratch (or not at all ).
[/quote]

Back ontopic, the format is jagex’s proprietary model format, as far as I know no one has published the format, however bentski did write an open source model viewer, so you may be able to get the info you need from that.[/quote]

bentski’s was for the old client, and only slightly worked, it crashed on lots of models.

if you TRULY wish to find out the model format, you would need to look into the client itself.

Read full topic

item.title: Model Grabber Question
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

sanga282:

what use is jsut viewing the models?

My im-/exporter will convert .mdl files to .c4d and back, and if you figure out how to pack the cache, you can have custom models!

Read full topic

item.title: Model Grabber Question
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

botmaster:

Quick question: What file format are these models in? I want to go and make an import script in python for blender3d, so I can edit them. This may require some research into the model format, so to spare some time, I’d rather ask here. If you don’t know, it’s okay, then I’ll have to do it from scratch (or not at all ).

Back ontopic, the format is jagex’s proprietary model format, as far as I know no one has published the format, however bentski did write an open source model viewer, so you may be able to get the info you need from that.

item.title: Model Grabber Question
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:6, topic:135056”][quote author=exe626 link=topic=186491.msg1704810#msg1704810 date=1188169995]
What was the point in bumping this topic Zachera?
Why do you sign your post with ‘~Z’, do you even know what ~ is?
[/quote]
~ is a tildé.[/quote]

correct, in java it is bitwise operator to invert bytes.
it can also be referred to in maths, as “equivalent to” eg “y ~ x” means y is equivalent to x

Read full topic

item.title: Model Grabber Question
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

It just downloads the models to VIEW. You cannot actually use them in the client unless you find your own way to load them.

~Z
